body_html: Context: this is needed for the XLA integration. There's no clean way to implement aten::size in XLA, but it can be statically evaluated when all the shapes are known. ResNet-50 uses this operator after the average pool, it would prevent translation to XLA without constant propagation.
body_text: Context: this is needed for the XLA integration. There's no clean way to implement aten::size in XLA, but it can be statically evaluated when all the shapes are known. ResNet-50 uses this operator after the average pool, it would prevent translation to XLA without constant propagation.
body: Context: this is needed for the XLA integration. There's no clean way to implement `aten::size` in XLA, but it can be statically evaluated when all the shapes are known. ResNet-50 uses this operator after the average pool, it would prevent translation to XLA without constant propagation.
